titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2020.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2020 May 7.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-22 15:42:00 -0700.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Victor Sedillo documented the early LA punk scene of the late 1970s, with an emphasis on San Pedro, Wilmington, and Long Beach. Sedillo's photographs have been exhibited at LA Harbor College, Cameravision Gallery, and Angels Gate Cultural Center. Additionally, his photographs have been published in numerous publications, including the book, A Wailing of a Town: "An Oral History of Early San Pedro Punk and More," 1977-1985 by Craig Ibarra. The Victor Sedillo photographs range in date from 1979-1980 and include black and white images of performances, bands, fans, and venues across Los Angeles.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Victor Sedillo photographs (Collection 2378). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection is a portion of Sedillo's photographic archive. Sedillo retains custody of the rest of his photographs and has not donated his work to any other institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Kelly Besser with assistance from Tess Livesley-O'Neil, 2020.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Victor Sedillo documented the early LA punk scene of the late 1970s, with an emphasis on San Pedro, Wilmington, and Long Beach. Sedillo's photographs have been exhibited at LA Harbor College, Cameravision Gallery, and Angels Gate Cultural Center. Additionally, his photographs have been published in numerous publications, including the book, A Wailing of a Town: "An Oral History of Early San Pedro Punk and More," 1977-1985 by Craig Ibarra.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Victor Sedillo photographs range in date from 1979-1980 and include mounted and unmounted black and white images of punk rock performances, bands, fans, and venues across Los Angeles. Images of bands and performers include the following: The Screamers, Tomata du Plenty, Saccharine Trust, IUD, Zoo Barry, Laurie Monitor, Pat Delaney, Bee People, The Mutants, Alleycats, Dianne Chai, The Gears, Axxel G. Reese, Tito Larriva, Plugz, Nervous Gender, Joe Baiza, Mike Watt, D. Boon, The Minutemen, Sue Tissue, Suburban Lawns, Jane Drano (aka Jane Wiedlin), UXA, Dee Dee Detroit, The Weirdos, The Stains, X, Sue Zoo, Vomit Girl, and Nancy Sekizawa (aka Atomic Nancy). Sedillo photographed performances at the following venues: Hong Kong Cafe, Jett's Cafe, Madame Wong's, The Roxy, The Nugget, The Whiskey, The Fleetwood, Hollywood Palladium, and the Atomic Cafe.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection's original arrangement has been maintained.
